alert.note: Alert for Whitman (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 6:22AM PST until December 28 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Paradise Creek at Moscow affecting Whitman and Latah Counties. .Heavy rain falling and melting snow will lead to rapid rises on Paradise Creek. Warm and windy weather Tuesday will also contribute to runoff from melting snow. For the Paradise Creek ...including Moscow...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Paradise Creek at Moscow. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.2 feet, Water will be out of the creek at the intersection of Bridge Street and Hillcrest Drive and may also be flowing into the intersection at this stage. At 10.0 feet, Water will be up to the homes near the intersection of Bridge and Hillcrest. Intersection at 5th and Roosevelt will be flooded. Water will be out of the banks at the D Street bridge. Storm drains along Main Street will be backed up and overflowing. Mountainview Park will be flooded. Bike path along the creek near the University will be under 6 inches of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The creek will crest near 9.6 feet late Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 9.2 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 03/30/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Paradise Creek Moscow 9.2 9.1 Tue 5 am PST 8.7 7.4 6.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/spokane. The next statement will be issued this evening at 615 PM PST.
